sn2.23:4.1: Standing to one side, the god Serī addressed the Buddha in verse:
sn2.23:5.3: So what’s the name of the spirit
sn2.23:6.2: and a clear and confident heart,
sn2.23:6.4: in this world and the next.
sn2.23:7.2: overcoming that stain, and give a gift.
sn2.23:7.3: The good deeds of sentient beings
sn2.23:7.4: support them in the next world.”
sn2.23:8.2: how well said this was by Master Gotama. He repeated the Buddha’s verses, and said:
sn2.23:11.1: Once upon a time, sir, I was a king named Serī, a giver, a donor, who praised giving.
sn2.23:11.2: I gave gifts at the four gates to ascetics and brahmins, to paupers, vagrants, travelers, and beggars.
sn2.23:11.3: Then the ladies of my harem approached me and said:
sn2.23:11.6: Your majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
sn2.23:11.8: ‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
sn2.23:11.9: When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’
sn2.23:11.10: And so I gave the first gate to the ladies of my harem.
sn2.23:12.1: Then my aristocrat vassals approached me and said:
sn2.23:12.3: the ladies of your harem give gifts,
sn2.23:12.5: Your majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
sn2.23:12.7: ‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
sn2.23:12.8: When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’
sn2.23:12.9: And so I gave the second gate to my aristocrat vassals.
sn2.23:12.10: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.
sn2.23:13.1: Then my troops approached me and said:
sn2.23:13.3: the ladies of your harem give gifts,
sn2.23:13.6: Your majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
sn2.23:13.8: ‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
sn2.23:13.9: When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’
sn2.23:13.10: And so I gave the third gate to my troops.
sn2.23:13.11: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.
sn2.23:14.1: Then my brahmins and householders approached me and said:
sn2.23:14.3: the ladies of your harem give gifts,
sn2.23:14.7: Your majesty, please support us to give gifts and make merit.’
sn2.23:14.9: ‘I’m a giver, a donor, who praises giving.
sn2.23:14.10: When they say, “We would give gifts”, what am I to say?’
sn2.23:14.11: And so I gave the third gate to my brahmins and householders.
sn2.23:14.12: There they gave gifts, while my own giving dwindled.
sn2.23:15.1: Then my men approached me and said:
sn2.23:15.2: ‘Now Your Majesty is not giving gifts at all!’
sn2.23:15.3: When they said this, I said to those men:
sn2.23:15.4: ‘Well then, sirs, send half of the revenue from the outer districts to the royal compound. Then give half right there to ascetics and brahmins, to paupers, vagrants, travelers, and beggars.’
sn2.23:15.5: Sir, for a long time I made so much merit and did so many skilful deeds. I never reach any limit so as to say
sn2.23:15.6: ‘there’s this much merit’ or ‘there’s this much result of merit’ or ‘for so long I’ll remain in heaven’.
sn2.23:15.8: how well said this was by Master Gotama:
sn2.23:16.2: and a clear and confident heart,
sn2.23:16.4: in this world and the next.
sn2.23:17.2: overcoming that stain, and give a gift.
sn2.23:17.3: The good deeds of sentient beings
sn2.23:17.4: support them in the next world.”
